content.description: A researcher is investigating whether a difference exists in the mean weight of green-striped watermelons grown on two different farms: one that uses organic methods and one that uses nonorganic methods. The mean and standard deviation of the weights in a random sample of 43 watermelons from the organic farm were 18 pounds and 2 pounds, respectively. The mean and standard deviation of the weights in a random sample of 40 watermelons from the nonorganic farm were 20 pounds and 1.7 pounds, respectively.
content.question: Which of the following represents the standard error of the difference in the mean weights of watermelons from the two farms?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 2 and denominator 43, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 1.7 and denominator 40, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>43</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1.7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2 and denominator the square root of 43, end root, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 1.7 and denominator the square root of 40, end root, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>43</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1.7</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 2 squared and denominator 43, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 1.7 squared and denominator 40, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>43</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1.7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 2 squared plus 1.7 squared, and denominator 43 plus 40, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>1.7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>43</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 2 squared and denominator 43, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 1.7 squared and denominator 40, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>43</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1.7</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

topic.text: 7.6: Confidence Intervals for the Difference of Two Means

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
